position.marginalia_text: Brederodi Tabula Pandectarum; necessaria, et utilissima Synopsis Digestorum: nec quicquam pra[e]gnantius tam serio, solidoq[ue] Compendio: tam ad ipsam praxin forensem, quàm ad artem ciuilem. Aureum Alphabetum Mnemonicon. Logica cuiusq[ue] Materia[e] ratio, supplenda ex Qua[e]stionisbus Justinianeis: ex his Paratitlis Pandectarum: ex Analysi Consiliorum Zasij: maximeq[ue] ex ipsa Logica Jureconsultorum. Qua[e] in primis necessaria ad unguem. Solus adhuc Freigius Analysi Juris Dialectica[e] operam dedit: vt Genesi solus Vulteius primum; nunc etiam tandem Althusius.

book.title: Quaestiones iustinianeae in institutiones iuris civilis cum analysi logica et politica aliquot consiliorum Zasij
Paratitla seu synopsis pandectarum iuris ciuilis

marginalia.translation: Brederode's table of the 'Digest' is extremely useful, an indispensable synopsis, and not something more pregant than a serious, solid compendium, as much for public practice as for civil art. The mnemonic 'Alphabetum aureum'. The logical rationale for its material is to be supplied from the 'Quaestiones iustinianeae', from this 'Paratitla', from Zasius's analysis of opinions, and most of all from the 'De logica iureconsultorum'. This is, to be clear, what is necessary first and foremost. Thus far, only Freigius has gone to the trouble of analysing law by dialectic, as firstly Vulteius did with Genesis and likewise finally Althusius.
